item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Recipes List
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/disney-dreamlight-valley-recipes-list/1100-6507171/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Dreamlight Valley recipes list grows longer with every update. In Disney Dreamlight Valley, you will need to grow crops and forage for food as part of your ongoing adventure in the Valley. Once you have gathered plenty of different ingredients, you will likely want to try your hand at cooking up some delicious meals. Cooking can make your crops worth more to sell or can even be gifted to the various characters around the Valley to improve your friendship with them.

Early in the game, you will be introduced to the concept of recipe books, which will teach you how to make a single dish. While this happens infrequently throughout the game, you can also learn how to cook new recipes by just trying things. If you put the correct ingredients in the pot, you will create a new dish and unlock that recipe in the collection. That means as long as you know what ingredients are needed and have them, you can make any dish in the game.

Recipes in Disney Dreamlight Valley will require one of two things. The recipe will either require you to have the exact ingredients listed. For example, Creamy Garlic Scallops require Scallops, Garlic, Lemon, and Butter. Other recipes will require any ingredient from a certain category. For example, Fish Steak requires Tomato, Basil, and any fish. It could be Cod, Salmon, or Tuna, it doesn't matter, as long as it's in that category.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Disney Dreamlight Valley recipes
    • 1-Star Meals
    • 2-Star Meals
    • 3-Star Meals
    • 4-Star Meals
    • 5-Star Meals
  • A Rift in Time recipes

    • 2-Star Meals
    • 3-Star Meals
    • 4-Star Meals
    • 5-Star Meals
  • The Storybook Vale recipes
    • 1-Star Meals
    • 2-Star Meals
    • 3-Star Meals
    • 4-Star Meals
    • 5-Star Meals
  • Best meals for energy in Dreamlight Valley

Disney Dreamlight Valley recipes

These recipes are available in the base game and do not require any additional purchases to access.

1-Star Meals

These meals require one ingredient to cook.

Appetizers

  • Cheese Platter - Cheese
  • Coffee - Coffee Bean
  • Crackers - Any Grain
  • Crudités - Any vegetable
  • Grilled Vegetables - Any Vegetable
  • Hard-Boiled Eggs - Egg
  • Okra Soup - Okra
  • Purée - Potato
  • Salad - Lettuce
  • Seafood Appetizer - Any Seafood
  • Tomato Soup - Tomato

Entrées

  • Grilled Fish - Any Fish
  • Hors d-Oeuvres - Any Herb
  • Leek Soup - Leek

Desserts

The Storybook Vale recipes

  • Flavored Chia Pudding - Chia Seeds, Rhubarb, Cinnamon, Any Sweet
  • Loaded Breakfast Yogurt - Oats, Yogurt, Spiral Strawberry, Ambrosia
  • Loaded Golden Apple Porridge - Oats x2, Golden Apple, Ambrosia
  • Loaded Honeydew Porridge - Oats x2, Honeydew, Ambrosia
  • Loaded Persimmon Porridge - Oats x2, Persimmon, Ambrosia
  • Loaded Rhubarb Porridge - Oats x2, Rhubarb, Ambrosia
  • Loaded Sea Grape Porridge - Oats x2, Sea Grapes, Ambrosia
  • Lupine Cullen Skink - Sea Wolf, Onion, Potato, Yogurt
  • Persimmon Chia Pancakes - Wheat, Chia Seeds, Shovelbird Egg, Persimmon
  • Sea Grape Chia Pancakes - Wheat, Chia Seeds, Shovelbird Egg, Sea Grapes
  • Seaweed Salad - Radish, Any Vegetable, Sea Grapes, Black Pepper
  • Shovelbird Eggs Benedict - Elysian Grain, Shovelbird Egg, Spiral, Strawberry, Salt Crystal
  • Spiral Strawberry Chia Pancakes - Wheat, Chia Seeds, Shovelbird Egg, Spiral Strawberry

Desserts

  • Cinnamon Cookies - Wheat, Yogurt, Cinnamon, Any Sweet
  • Cinnamon Cake - Wheat, Shovelbird Egg, Yogurt, Cinnamon
  • Lightning Cake - Wheat, Shovelbird Egg, Yogurt, Lightning Spice
  • Lightning Cookies - Wheat, Yogurt, Lightning Spice, Any Sweet
  • Nutmeg Cake - Wheat, Shovelbird Egg, Yogurt, Nutmeg
  • Nutmeg Cookies - Wheat, Yogurt, Nutmeg, Any Sweet
  • Strawberry Rhubarb Pie - Wheat, Yogurt, Rhubarb, Spiral Strawberry

5-Star Meals

These meals require five ingredients to cook.

Appetizers

  • Caprese Salad - Any Vegetable, Flyleaf Feta, Olives, Salt Crystal, Any Spice
  • Greek Potatoes - Potato, Any Fruit, Garlic, Salt Crystal, Any Spice
  • Lightning Bolt - Stygian Mudskipper, Lamprey, Any Sweet, Lightning Spice x2

Entrées

  • Argossian Pizza - Elysian Grain, Onion, Any Vegetable, Flyleaf Feta, Olives
  • Chimera Skewer - Hippocampus, Trumpet Snail, Flying Fish, Any Fish, Brussel Sprouts
  • Flying Fish Quenelle - Flying Fish, Porcini Mushrooms, Any Vegetable, Flyleaf Feta x2
  • Grecian Fish Bake - Stygian Mudskipper, Elysian Grain, Olives, Salt Crystal, Ambrosia
  • Greek Salad - Cucumber, Radish, Any Vegetable, Flyleaf Feta, Olives
  • Grilled Koi Gyro - Koi, Wheat, Cucumber, Olives, Any Spice
  • Hippocampus Cepelinai Dumplings - Hippocampus, Onion, Potato, Spiral Strawberry, Black Pepper
  • Mussel Risotto - Mussel, Rice, Olives, Garlic, Any Spice
  • Roasted Barley and Veggies - Barley, Brussel Sprouts, Onion, Any Vegetable, Flyleaf Feta
  • Spanakopita - Onion, Spinach, Flyleaf Feta, Garlic, Any Spice

Desserts

  • Merryweather's Gingersnaps - Faerie Rye, Shovelbird Egg, Ginger, Nutmeg, Sour Berries
  • Unbirthday Cake - Faerie Rye, Shovelbird Egg, Yogurt, Nutmeg, Ambrosia

Best meals for energy in Dreamlight Valley

Each meal in Disney Dreamlight Valley provides you with energy, but they're not all created equally. You may even be surprised to hear that higher-star meals don't always equate to the highest gains in energy. Here are the meals that provide the most energy, but check below the list for our pick for the meal that offers the most efficient use of time and ingredients.

  • Thousand Needles - 5000 energy
  • Barbecued Brilliant Starfish - 3118 energy
  • Sand Worm Carpaccio Plate - 3004 energy
  • Barbecued Pretty Pink Starfish - 2812 energy
  • Conch Ceviche - 2646 energy

With the absolute highest energy meals out of the way, our pick for the most efficient use of your time and ingredients is Berry Salad. This simple 3-star meal can fill nearly 80% of your gold energy (and even more if you add extra berries when making it). Combine the relatively high energy replenishment with the fact that these three required berries are such a cinch to forage, and you've got yourself a quick meal choice to keep on hand for filling your energy.

We have dozens of Dreamlight Valley guides to help you every step of the way. Find them all in our Dreamlight Valley guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Apple AirPods Pro 2 Drop To Their Lowest Price For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/apple-airpods-pro-2-drop-to-their-lowest-price-for-black-friday/1100-6527946/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Black Friday has kicked off early this month, and if you're looking for a deal on headsets and earbuds, you can pick up a set of Apple Airpods Pro 2 for $160. This is the lowest price ever for these--previously, it was $170 during Prime Day in July--as they normally retail for $250.

This set comes with a MagSafe Charging Case (USB-C) and several sets of silicone ear tips to help you fine-tune the fit. What's really nice about these earbuds is that they sit comfortably in your ears, as the silicone tips don't push into your ear canals. If you're the kind of person who hates earplugs, for example, then these are a great option as they're lightweight and you'll barely feel them when they're placed in your ears.

For the hardware inside of each earbud, there's a powerful Apple H2 chip that can deliver really good audio quality and excellent noise cancellation. These are particularly good at drowning out background noise and you can even use them at gym, although admittedly, you're still going to hear some sounds if your local exercise joint plays music at an unbearably loud level. These will still do a good job of masking most of the noise with its ANC technology, and both the AirPods Pro and the MagSafe Charging Case are IP54-rated, meaning they're dust, sweat, and water-resistant.

They also feature various touch controls to manage playback functions and Siri interactions, and if you have an iPhone or iPad with iOS 18 installed, these have been authorized by the US Food and Drug Administration to function as over-the-counter hearing aids.

Black Friday Headset Deals

  • Beats Solo 4 headset -- $100 ($200)
  • Bose QuietComfort headset -- $200 ($350)
  • Sony WH-1000XM4 headset -- $198 ($348)
  • Sony WH-1000XM5 headset -- $298 ($400)
  • JBL Tune 720BT headset -- $40 ($80)
  • Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro earbuds -- $189 ($250)
  • Sonos Ace headset -- $350 ($450)
  • JBL Live Pro 2 earbuds -- $75 ($150)

Several other headsets are on sale for Black Friday as well, like the Beats Solo 4 headset for $100 (was $200), the Sony WH-1000XM5 with excellent ANC for $298 (was $400), and the Sonos Ace headset for $350 (was $450).

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Fortnite Remix Finale Features Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Ice Spice, And Juice WRLD Tribute
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-remix-finale-features-snoop-dogg-eminem-ice-spice-and-juice-wrld-tribute/1100-6527943/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The end of Fortnite Remix Chapter 2 is quickly approaching, and Epic Games has revealed a star-studded concert to close out the season. Fortnite's Remix: The Finale concert features Snoop Dogg, Eminem, and Ice Spice, as well as a tribute to the late rapper Juice WRLD. Players can also earn a Juice WRLD skin and other cosmetics for a limited time.

The Remix: The Finale takes over Fortnite's battle-royale island on November 30 starting at 11 AM PT / 2 PM ET. Epic Games described the experience as an "in-game concert event that connects dreamscapes" with Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Ice Spice, and Juice WRLD. The concert includes a new single from Snoop Dogg called "Another Part Of Me (feat. Sting)", as well as the exclusive world premiere of an all-new Juice WRLD track called "Empty Out Your Pockets."

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Fortnite Chapter 2 Remix - Official Cinematic Trailer

The developer suggests that players login early on November 30 to queue for the event, but also says it intends to run an encore of the performance later that day, assuming no technical issues arise.

As an additional tribute to celebrate Juice WRLD's legacy, Fortnite's map is adding the new "WRLD Point" landmark, which will blossom on the map and the area will spread and grow over time. Players can also keep their teammates healed up with the new Juice WRLD's Chug Cannon, which is available now in the game's loot pool.

All players who log in between 6 AM PT / 9 AM ET on November 25 and 7 PM PT / 10 PM ET on November 30 will receive a Juice WRLD bundle the next day that they log in. This includes the following items:

  • Slayer Juice WRLD Outfit
  • 999 Knives Pickaxe
  • 999 Knives Back Bling
  • Adventure, Remix'd Loading Screen
  • Number One Remix Loading Screen
  • Remix With the Golden Touch Loading Screen
  • Juice’s WRLD Loading Screen (Art by Takashi Murakami)

More Juice WRLD items arrive in the Fortnite Shop on November 27 at 4 PM PT / 7 PM ET, including the WRLD Takeover Bundle. This bundle is priced at 2,600 V-Bucks (just over $20) and features all of the below:

  • Juice WRLD Outfit (includes reactive dreampop style)
  • Studded Skull Back Bling (includes reactive dreampop style)
  • Lean Wit Me Jam Track
  • Lucid Dreams Jam Track
  • 999 Wrap
  • WRLD Keys Keytar

Fortnite Remix Chapter 2's ending means a new Chapter of Fortnite is quickly approaching, and here we highlight everything we know about Chapter 6. Additionally, Fortnite's new shoe cosmetics go live later this week, meaning players can finally lace up and start wearing their in-game Jordans.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth Won't Have Any DLC--And For A Good Reason
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/final-fantasy-vii-rebirth-wont-have-any-dlc-and-for-a-good-reason/1100-6527945/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is one of the biggest games of 2024 becoming a top seller and nabbed several award nominations for this year's The Game Awards. For the second installment of the massive Remake trilogy, players have been curious if DLC is in the pipeline, but the game's director, Naoki Hamaguchi, confirmed that there are no plans for any expansions for Rebirth--but that's okay for a very solid reason.

Talking to the Daily Star about all things Final Fantasy, Hamaguchi said there weren't any plans since he and his team are focused on getting the yet-to-be-named Part 3 out as soon as they can.

The Biggest Changes In Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

"We definitely do hear the desire from fans, the voices out there that want that kind of thing," Hamaguchi said. "I understand it completely, but I think, from my perspective, what the fans really want to see the most is not necessarily DLC. They want to see the third part of the series as quickly as possible."

Seeing how the first part of the trilogy launched in 2020 for the PS4, with the DLC a year later that focused on Yuffie as a playable character--subtitled Intermission--fans might have taken that as setting a precedent since these games are so colossal. That DLC was later rolled into the PS5 version of Final Fantasy 7 Remake and renamed Intergrade.

"So that's why we've decided not to focus the development resources on creating additional extra episodes for DLC at the moment," he added. "We really are putting all our efforts into getting the third game out as quickly as we can. So for the moment, that's where we're focusing our time. I want [Remake Chapter 3] to come out as quickly as possible, and then move on maybe to look at some other stories, dig a bit deeper."

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
